CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant started working at a privately owned factory in the city of ORG . On DATE he had an accident in the factory and seriously injured his leg . ORG , on CARDINAL DATE the applicant 's employment at the factory was terminated on the ground that he had failed to report to work DATE without a reason .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant brought a legal action against the factory before ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) and claimed pecuniary compensation in respect of the accident . In the meantime , in DATE the applicant 's leg had to be amputated following the diagnosis of a malignant tumour in his injured leg .

CARDINAL . On DATE , while the proceedings were pending before ORG , the applicant brought another action before ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) against the factory and asked the court to issue a declaration to the effect that the incident had been an “ occupational accident ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at the applicant 's request , ORG decided to adjourn its examination of the compensation claim pending the outcome of the proceedings before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , relying on CARDINAL expert reports , decided that the accident had been occupational . Nevertheless , the decision of ORG was quashed on DATE by ORG , which held that ORG ( ORG “ the ORG ” ) should also be a party to the proceedings .
CARDINAL . Proceedings recommenced before ORG , which found on DATE that the applicant had introduced the same claim in DATE , and dismissed the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of ORG and pointed to the fact that the case which had been brought in DATE had had different parties and its subject matter had also been different to that of the present one .
CARDINAL . On DATE , after a further review of the case , ORG gave a decision and held that the accident had been occupational .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment once more and held that ORG should have considered whether a causal link existed between the tumour in the applicant 's leg and the accident . ORG considered that this could be done by obtaining a report from ORG ( “ the Institution ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after re - examining the case , ORG confirmed its judgment of DATE . In its decision , ORG maintained that any causal link between the tumour and the accident was irrelevant to the case at hand . It considered that this was a matter for ORG to consider in its examination of the applicant 's compensation claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision of DATE and upheld ORG decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG asked the Institution to draft a report as required by ORG . On DATE the ORG requested ORG to forward to it all medical reports pertaining to the applicant 's medical treatment . Following the failure of ORG to comply with its request , the ORG repeated its request on CARDINAL further occasions . ORG , which did not comply with the ORG 's requests , asked the Institution to prepare its report on the basis of the reports already in its possession .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Institution prepared its report based on several medical reports on the applicant delivered by different hospitals DATE . It concluded that it was not possible to establish whether the tumour in the leg had been caused by the accident . In its report the ORG also noted that the applicant , although warned by the doctors about the gravity of his condition , had failed to have medical examinations DATE . It concluded that this could also have caused the tumour in the applicant 's leg .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted to ORG written objections to the ORG 's report . He argued , in particular , that the report was irrelevant to the examination of his claim and in any event was based on insufficient data . The applicant further argued that ORG had prepared a negative report as he had lodged a complaint against the experts regarding the delay in the submission of their report .

CARDINAL . Based on the report of the Institution , ORG decided on DATE that there was no causal link between the accident and the tumour in the applicant 's leg , and dismissed the case . On DATE the applicant appealed and repeated his objections , mentioned above , to the ORG 's report . The applicant 's appeal was rejected by ORG DATE .

CARDINAL . Following the decision of ORG , ORG resumed the proceedings . On DATE the domestic court rejected the applicant 's case based on the decision of ORG dated DATE . In its decision , it stated that ORG had had regard to all the documents in the case file , the submissions of the parties and the medical report of ORG which held that there was no causal link between the tumour in the applicant 's leg and the incident . As a result , by making reference to the decision of ORG it dismissed the applicant 's case . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's appeal request .
